body_html:
I'd like to bring this back to our attention. As we try to make TF more modular, including loading of external kernels, this kind of issue will come up over and over again. We need a way to describe that a certain plugin/kernel is needed when loading a metagraph, and at least issuing an error message like "please import the following python module before loading the metagraph"; perhaps with a centralized hint table that maps kernels to c++ library names / python module names.
…
On Tue, Oct 31, 2017 at 9:23 AM, Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote: It's too far out to really reason about. We will for now eagerly load all the dlls we find (which are appropriate for the machine architecture we're on, e.g., we may skip the one containing GPU kernels on a machine without GPU, or the one built with AVX512 on a machine without that SIMD instruction set. @gunan <https://github.com/gunan> FYI. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#12927 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2PmzOTyrhae7zMGp5Zix6mjdy2nks5sx0lxgaJpZM4PR3m6> .
body_text:
I'd like to bring this back to our attention.  As we try to make TF more
modular, including loading of external kernels, this kind of issue will
come up over and over again.  We need a way to describe that a certain
plugin/kernel is needed when loading a metagraph, and at least issuing an
error message like "please import the following python module before
loading the metagraph"; perhaps with a centralized hint table that maps
kernels to c++ library names / python module names.
…
On Tue, Oct 31, 2017 at 9:23 AM, Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote:
 It's too far out to really reason about.

 We will for now eagerly load all the dlls we find (which are appropriate
 for the machine architecture we're on, e.g., we may skip the one containing
 GPU kernels on a machine without GPU, or the one built with AVX512 on a
 machine without that SIMD instruction set. @gunan
 <https://github.com/gunan> FYI.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#12927 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2PmzOTyrhae7zMGp5Zix6mjdy2nks5sx0lxgaJpZM4PR3m6>
 .
body:
I'd like to bring this back to our attention.  As we try to make TF more
modular, including loading of external kernels, this kind of issue will
come up over and over again.  We need a way to describe that a certain
plugin/kernel is needed when loading a metagraph, and at least issuing an
error message like "please import the following python module before
loading the metagraph"; perhaps with a centralized hint table that maps
kernels to c++ library names / python module names.

On Tue, Oct 31, 2017 at 9:23 AM, Martin Wicke <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> It's too far out to really reason about.
>
> We will for now eagerly load all the dlls we find (which are appropriate
> for the machine architecture we're on, e.g., we may skip the one containing
> GPU kernels on a machine without GPU, or the one built with AVX512 on a
> machine without that SIMD instruction set. @gunan
> <https://github.com/gunan> FYI.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12927#issuecomment-340817682>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2PmzOTyrhae7zMGp5Zix6mjdy2nks5sx0lxgaJpZM4PR3m6>
> .
>
